Articles.Content:
(I suggest you read this may sound crazy before reading this)

Ok one of life's hardest questions....... How did kerbals evolve? So all we know about kerbals so far is

1.they are green-ish

2.they are spongy

3.and they have big heads

So tell me your opinions

I got this idea from an enter Elysium series called kerbal rising
I believe Kerbals evolved from reptiles of some sort.

I believe that after a nuclear Armageddon on Earth, small roaches took huge amounts of radiation, and grew very large and very smart. They adopted what human technology they could to their own use.

Also, their love of snacks simply comes from the fact that aside from the Kerbals ancestor, Twinkies were the only thing to survive.
Well, presumably Kerbals evolved from some other, unknown Kerbin lifeform that was greenish, spongy, and had large heads.

Well, presumably Kerbals evolved from some other, unknown Kerbin lifeform that was greenish, spongy, and had large heads.

Kerbia-bacterium-bigeous-headeus I think
I'm gonna guess a form of amphibians, who when frogs were evolving the ability to jump across ponds put two sticks together and rowed a leaf across the pond
The evolved from saurupods... the kerbalsaurus wrecks to be praticular, as I stated in the last thread to ask
Kerbals were created and scattered across Kerbin by the great HavesteR in the sky. That's why they have an irresistible desire to explore space. To find their creator and get updated.
They evolved from a form of puffball mushroom, when they "die" they're actually dispersing into a cloud of spores and we help them reproduce!
